pros: Great team, clinicians, patients, beautiful area

review_title: Pays well but it’s just a job
pros: The pay is good the benefits are good and the people you work with can be good.
cons: Leadership is not interested in making the place better for it’s workers, at all. They pay well because of the union representation. The benefits are solid but because tenured employees got away with a strong, free PPO for years… when they had to start paying for it, they complained. Even paying for the PPO is worth it as it’s still a great option. An HMO is offered free for a single worker who is part time or full time.

review_title: A great family workplace, but not a place for growth.
pros: This company is excellent with highly competitive benefits and wages. There is a culture focused on more than clocking out at the end of the day. The staff here lean on each other in bad times and provide a shoulder for others in good times. This isn't a workplace, it's a family.
cons: Unless you're already established and looking to become a director, there are no stepping stones for growth. You will stay in the same job for years simply for lack of open positions. They are also unwilling to create new positions.

review_title: Average place to jumpstart your career. Not a magnet hospital, so new grads do not get much training.
job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Greenbrae, CA
pros: Average salary, good benefits. It is very unit dependent. My unit has its pros and cons. But a good overall place to jumpstart your nursing career.
cons:
Patient assignments can be wacky. Some poor communication here and there. 
0 diversity.

pros: Lots of support for advancement and challenging work that serves the community.
cons: COVID made working in the medical field much more challenging for hospital staff.

pros: Decent benefits. Dynamic new leadership.

pros: Never any issues getting supplies, good nurse leadership.

job_title: Front Desk Receptionist in Greenbrae, CA
pros: Great coworkers, good benefits. Free parking and decent hours, that is about all. Lots of cons outweigh the pros in this place.
cons:
Zero communication from management. One of our managers left and then the director and then we just had a supervisor. The supervisor was doing a great job, lots of communication and support. Then another manager stepped in and pulled away the communication by micromanaging the department. Taking on all of the work and not sharing basic information is a form of toxic mismanagement and that’s what this person does. 
That manager gossips and told his entire department that an employee quit over the phone and swore at him. That is not and should not be public information. He also told another staff member she was not needed there because she is pregnant. She went to HR and they didn’t do anything. 
Toxic. Stay. Away.

They don 't train you on anything, you are pretty much on your own from day one and if you try asking them questions they hand you books to read instead of proper training. No opportunities for advancement. Micromanage everything you do..Requests were never clear and if you question anything they look at you like you're stupid.

review_title: great place to work and live!

pros: patients very nice new clean building

pros: Great team, learning environment, and good location
cons: None that I experienced or know of

pros: Located in a nice area with great places to walk to during your lunch break.
cons:
Before accepting a position at Marin Imaging Breast Center, I had been warned and unfortunately didn't listen.  I was actually hopeful and didn't think it would be that bad.  Ohh, its not bad, its HORRIBLE!!!  Manager is completely out of line with employees, yells at them, stands in front of exam door to listen to your conversation with patients and will not reprimand those that cause a hostile environment.
  I don't understand why Marin General would have someone in that position that clearly doesn't know what they are doing, and doesn't bring the department up, but will make sure you are always down.  Negative remarks and being called into the office are the norm.  Your opinion will not matter here, and you will be blamed for things you didn't do or have any control over.  HR isn't helpful either, unfortunately.   
 There are only three mammography technologists working in the entire place now.  Leadership is lacking,and department is quickly falling apart.  Don't join the mess!!

review_title: Great Co-Workers, Not so great leadership.
job_title: Applications Analyst III in San Rafael, CA
pros: I worked within IT with some of the most competent individuals around. Everyone was vested in making MGH a better place.
cons: Leadership within IT is lacking. Rather than leading by example, exercising truth and humility, and keeping professionalism central to strategy, some choose to undercut staff efforts by taking credit and stifling growth. Some get promoted regardless of experience or qualifications. This leads to risky behavior and mistakes that could be prevented. Overuse of contract workers makes it an ever changing environment with no stability. When I left, staff turnover was an issue and positions were not being backfilled. This left too much work for too few people. We were all replaceable with contractors according to leadership.

pros: When you see the marketing tag line, "this is my healing place," they mean it.  The team at Marin General walk the walk and talk the talk.  I recently relocated from outside the California area and it was the culture that drew me into my new position at Marin.  The teamwork is excellent.  The physicians are our partners.  Our patients are our community neighbors.  The salary is competitive and our benefits are outstanding!  I consider myself blessed to be a part of such a wonderful team and community hospital.  Did I mention free parking?
cons: None, this is the place to work on the East side!

review_title: Excellent company, the future looks bright!
pros: Excellent benefits, excellent work life balance, excellent training and resources available to staff, promotions from within, wonderful core staff makes each day a pleasure to come to work, excellent pay, senior leadership are approachable and easy to talk with, excellent growth potential, good pay and company!
cons: Software systems need to be upgraded, it has been trying with the construction to deal with change, but it looks like it will be worth it!

pros: The pay is on par with the Bay Area, that is about it...
cons: Staff is treated like drones.  There is no autonomy.  The facility is bogged down in politics and there is no forward thinking or cutting edge medicine going on here.  Management can be outright belligerent to staff. There is a very high staff turn over right now.  I have been here for years and I never thought I would want to leave, but I find myself looking for work.

pros: Excellent compensation, experienced staff, and a positive working environment despite a changing environment.
cons: New hospital is being built because of the need to retrofit in case of earthquake. Nurse's union has been working hard for more than one year to get a renewed contact and no progress has been made because hospital is blocking negotiations. Administrators make high salaries and come and go frequently. This is somewhat distracting for a staff RN who just wants to take care of patients.

job_title: Sterile Processing Technician in Hercules, CA
pros: Great staff in my department, good benefits, and plenty of opportunity for growth
cons:
• Cafeteria kitchen closes at 7pm so, it makes it hard for the night shift people on those days they weren’t able to bring a lunch. Vending machines are only snacks & drinks, at least have vending machines that have sandwiches & lunchables, microwaveable food, etc.
• You have to use PTO on Holidays unless scheduled to work. Some other hospitals have it so that the employees get paid without having to use PTO.

pros:
Highest salary range for most positions in the SF bay area.
Located in a high income, gorgeous setting.
cons:
Patients, employees and manager speech & behaviors reek of superior entitlement attitude.  Lots of disrespectful, arrogant people work here.  Patients are often rude, demanding & demeaning.
C-suite is a revolving door for disengaged, strategy free "leaders".
Community relations are often combative and dismissive.
Not a place to plan a long term, satisfying career.

job_title: Monitor Telemetry Tech in Greenbrae, CA
pros: Good hospital staff, state of the art cath lab and procedures. Really nice neighborhood to work in and shopping in the surrounding area. People seem to care about their jobs ans take pride in what they do.
cons: Lack of leadership.The hospital is all about making a profit at your expense. They find reasons to fire people who are vested and have a retirement coming to them.

review_title: Stay for the pay, leave because of the culture
job_title: Clinical Nurse II in San Francisco, CA
pros:
Great pay
Great benefits
In general a low-acuity/highly compliant population
Getting EPIC and a new hospital in 2 years
My direct supervisors genuinely mean well and it’s not their fault, it’s their superiors, that this hospital is so crummy.
cons:
Terrible current charting system, old equipment
EVERYONE is burnt out. It is probably the most negative culture I’ve ever worked with. Absolutely no team work. Staff is just so nasty and negative to one another. Physicians have absolutely no respect for staff. 
Management makes everything much more difficult than it has to be with dumb, asinine policies that make no sense. They just say “it’s a safety issue” and that apparently makes it all okay. 
All their systems are outdated and the staff in payroll/HR/staffing are nasty. They talk down to you like you’re an idiot for not understanding their barbaric systems and they will not work with you under any circumstances. For instance, I had a personal conflict with a scheduled shift. I tried to contact my scheduler about it. She ignored my emails, texts, etc. She eventually scheduled a meeting with her supervisor. In that meeting, the scheduled shows up at the end and will not switch me off that night, even though she had already given travel nurses that same week off. I was told to “just call out” because her “hands were tied” even though they were “so short” that night. 
This hospital is impossible to get to any other way than with a car. If your car isn’t working good luck getting there. If you’re stuck in traffic, good luck as well because they mark you late at 7:01. No exceptions. 
I read the reviews on here before I started, I said “oh it can’t be that bad.” Trust me guys it is.

pros: Excellent benefits package, total compensation is in line or exceeds industry standards. Rewarding to work with grateful patients more often than not, also rewarding to try to help patients who are struggling. Lots of wellness opportunities such as discounts to gyms, onsite fitness classes, healthy eating/aerobic tutorials/weight management seminars. Generous retirement package - 403b and pension plan. I live in central Marin - easy to commute to and from work on most days.
cons: Hospital work environments are hectic - most days are very fast paced and priorities seem to change daily. Seems to be the standard for this industry.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Greenbrae, CA
pros: I Love working at MGH. For almost 4 years, I have worked here and been very pleased. The salary is great, it is a beautiful location & place to work. The Parking structure is new, Wellness at work is a great incentive for employees to maintain healthy life styles with reimbursement. Also good vacation time!
cons: Upper management does not always support grown with in there staff, moving from one role to another. Also there is a lack of communication with new protocols

pros: A lot of great employees, good pay and benefits. The clients are great.
cons: Team members beaten down at every turn.  Work hard, don't expect to get your breaks and know that you will be called into the office and asked to report on your coworkers. It's an environment where everyone smiles and pretends things are okay but they all know that can and will change at the whim of the manager.

review_title: Poor managment is killing this place
pros: coworkers and MDs are friendly and work well as a team.  Very experienced nurses were here to help newer nurses, and had a great learning environment.  Usually enough staff.
cons: Newer management has a bullying/ punitive style of management.  Seems like people are targeted to get pushed out.  No support if you go up the chain of command.  Experienced nurses are fleeing.

pros: Working with the patients was very satisfying.  Having any direct contact with management is toxic and would ruin your day repeatedly.
cons:
Some of the lowest, moral punching,degrading disrespectful behavior I have ever experienced in all my years of employment, This came from management and co-workers.  Very, very ugly stuff.
Favoritism run rampant. Back stabbing everywhere.  The only professionals were the M.D.s  Take a close look at turnover, if you can stomach it.  Largest group of horrible managers ever.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Greenbrae, CA
pros: There are many pros working at Marin General. The community that this hospital serves is one that is diverse in numerous ways so there is much to learn as a health care practitioner. The staff is friendly and supportive toward one another especially to those that are new employees. The hospital provides great benefits for their employees. The hospital is always seeking to improve in terms of work environment, policies and procedures, and overall patient satisfaction.
cons: There are no cons that I can think of while working at Marin General

pros:
Patient safety is top priority
Team environment
Excellent employee benefits
Employee Wellness program
Free parking
Administration supports and encourages care of self and care of colleagues
Partnership with academic facilities
Brand new hospital in less than 2 year with state of the art, healing environment
EMR upgrade to EPIC coming soon
A great group of people to work with who really care about the patient, and each other
cons: None-This is the employer you want to work for.

pros:
Healthcare coverage
PTO, retirement, HSA options
Competitive wages for entry level jobs
Union
cons:
Cold, corporate atmosphere
Administration is money driven
Management is petty and creates toxic environment by pitting employees against each other

job_title: Anonymous Employee in San Francisco, CA
pros: The salaries are good, the location is not only beautiful but close to freeway access.  There really is a feeling of community among employees.  Inter-departmental communication is excellent and overall it really feels like you are working with a team.
cons: There is not much opportunity for advancement, high turnover rate in management and there appears to be blatant favoritism.  In some areas workplace bullying from management is tolerated .

job_title: Radiology Support Associate in Greenbrae, CA
pros: A lot of nice people and helpful hands, If you like Medicine and a Health care environment then is the place for you.
cons: Disengagement from management, lack of commitment and training is not the best. Very hard for anybody who doesn't have experience working in a Hospital

pros: Excellent Benefits, wonderful Doctors, interaction with different staff in all departments and the opportunity to help our patients our community.
cons: Poorly organized, complete disconnection between management and staff. Absence of accountability, improper F/U and NO back up protocols. No opportunities to grow unless you have more than 10 years and know somebody. Big Company Corporate style environment (No one says good Morning!)

job_title: Unit Volunteer in Corte Madera, CA
pros: The vast majority of employees seem to be happy to be working at MGH.   The staff in custodial, admit roles and supplies management were most appreciative and helpful as I learned the ropes.
cons: There is less employee camaraderie at this hospital compared with others.   Could be due to all of the technology (e-charting etc) and resulting decrease in socializing.

job_title: RN Staff Nurse in Larkspur, CA
pros: Working in the ICU, we worked very well as a team. Everyone had each others backs and always stepped up to assist when needed. The staff was always helpful and friendly. Everybody was knowable and caring.
cons: Unfortunately, the management was transitioning and this caused some tension in the staff.

pros: This is a great place to work. I feel as though I am surrounded by talented people with expert ability. It feels very much like family. It is a collegial environment, nearly everyone is on a first name basis.
cons: Extremely poor IT System. We are using McKesson's (now Allscripts') Clinicial Hub. McKesson bears the responsibility for unleashing this truly substandard system.

job_title: Staff Nurse in San Rafael, CA
pros: Great atmosphere, great friendships, dedicated staff, fair pay
cons: Some patients from Marin County feel it's a resort,no adequate Christmas bonus,lheavy patient load

review_title: A great group of people to work with. Basically family!

pros: Everyone looks out for eachother. Nobody gets left knocked down. Benefits are pretty unbelievable. Pay is decent, but there is room for growth on the salary front.
cons: Extreme silos that delay projects.

pros: Good pay and fixed schedule
cons: management changes very often, some nurses work in the OR for more than 40 years, and they actually run the department. culture is bad, I hate going to work...

Excellent community hospital with superb physicians, nurses, and clinical teams who provide compassionate care to patients
